author: wsjcom
title: Don’t Forget the Good That SOX Has Done
text:
Regarding Scott S. Powell’s “A Pox on SOX, It’s Bad for Stocks” (op-ed, Feb. 14): It is ironic that the provision of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) of 2002—Section 404—that Mr. Powell blames for every real or imagined ill facing the American economy is the SOX provision that has perhaps the largest and most compelling body of evidence supporting its positive impact on U.S. capital formation.
